arts.ttl: Man Utd and Arsenal join Brighton in £5m winger transfer battle after scouting mission
arts.sum: Premier League and top clubs from across Europe are keeping tabs on Hammarby's talented teenage attacking gem Bazoumana Toure, who is tearing up the Sweden's Allsvenskan

arts.ttl: Brighton star's agent issues contract warning after Roberto De Zerbi transfer phone call
arts.sum: Julio Enciso is into the final two years of his current Brighton contract and former boss Roberto De Zerbi is understood to have expressed an interest in bringing the 20-year-old attacker to Marseille

arts.ttl: 'We knew how to attack them' - Cole Palmer highlights Brighton frailty after historic first-half goal haul
arts.sum: Chelsea's four-goal hero Cole Palmer said the game plan worked to perfection against Brighton.

arts.ttl: 'We did not have' - Fabian Hurzeler pinpoints where things went badly wrong for Brighton at Chelsea
arts.sum: Brighton manager Fabian Hurzeler has pinpointed where his side went wrong, after their first defeat of the season.

arts.ttl: X reacts as Cole Palmer breaks Premier League record in Brighton clash
arts.sum: The action swung the way of the visitors in the opening seven minutes as Georginio Rutter fired a header into the back of the net to give Brighton an early lead following a mistake from Robert Sanchez. Chelsea, not pleased with the thought of trailing, sprung into action, opening up the flood gates for Palmer.

arts.ttl: Chelsea 4-2 Brighton: Player ratings as Palmer scores four in Stamford Bridge thriller
arts.sum: Brighton should have pulled one back when Mats Wieffer rolled an effort from close range wide, but they got their reward from the resulting goal kick when Sanchez gifted the ball for Baleba to convert from close range. The hosts failed to deal with a Pervis Estupinan cross, with Carlos Baleba blocking Levi Colwill's clearance, and Georginio Rutter beat goalkeeper Robert Sanchez to the loose high ball, heading into an empty net.

arts.ttl: Three things you missed during Chelsea vs Brighton
arts.sum: In a thrilling Premier League match at Stamford Bridge between Chelsea and Brighton, here’s three things you might’ve missed.

arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca calls Cole Palmer the 'best player of the Premier League' as Brighton boss Fabian Hurzeler describes Chelsea star as unstoppable following his four-goal masterclass
arts.sum: Hurzeler said: 'He scored four goals. He punished every individual mistake. You can't stop him in one against one situations. We have to defend against him as a team.'

arts.ttl: Cole Palmer makes big claim following four-star Chelsea display
arts.sum: Cole Palmer believes he should have scored as many as six goals during Chelsea’s 4-2 win over Brighton on Saturday. The attacking midfielder set a new record at Stamford Bridge, becoming the first player to score four times before halftime in a Premier League match. “I should have had five or six,” Palmer told BBC […] The post Cole Palmer makes big claim following four-star Chelsea display first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Chelsea 4-2 Brighton PLAYER RATINGS: Cole Palmer was the standout performer but which Blues star could only muster a 4/10 and who else struggled for Enzo Maresca's side?
arts.sum: KEIRAN GILL AT STAMFORD BRIDGE: Chelsea had to come from behind to beat Brighton 4-2 thanks to Cole Palmer's heroics after Georginio Rutter had given the Seagulls the lead.
